messages.message:
Hi all — after discussing with lydia and shaunak, we realized that using mocks and certain test libraries with mypy was creating a lot of pain (and copious use of type: ignore). Therefore, we are addressing this with this PR: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/10271

What this means is that you should have no more need for type: ignore when using the mock library. If a stub or method is missing, please add it.

Also, if you ever find yourself confused by mypy or finding yourself needing to use type: ignore, please ping <#CKZNSMDSA|> with questions

I still have to look at this in more detail but this just made my night!! Thank you! :heart: glad we did not decide to go straight to a compiled language. i think we’ll need an instabase newsletter from @shaunak before deciding
Absolutely! Very fair concern about the pains of using mocks with mypy, so this PR should make it much easier to deal with that pain point
